pages.text: MIMI instruments are manually played and configured via the Instrument GUI.$(br2)This GUI provides both the ability to play notes on a piano keyboard and configure the MIDI settings of the instrument.$(br2)Note that at this time the keyboard controls for the instrument GUI are not configurable.

pages.title: The Piano Keyboard
pages.text: The largest component on the instrument GUI is the piano keyboard. This keyboard allows you to manually play notes on your instrument either by clicking the piano keys or pressing the keyboard keys associated with piano key.$(br2)The keyboard displays three octaves of notes at one time but can be shifted up and down.

pages.title: Shifting the Piano
pages.text: To shift the piano you can either click the shift buttons on the right side 'Shift' panel, or use the arrow keys on your keyboard that match the arrow on each shift GUI button.$(br2)Shifting +/- 1 moves the keyboard one natural note (white key) while +/- 7 moves the keyboard one full octave.$(br2)The $(l)<| Note$() indicator displays the minimum note on the piano that is currently visible.

pages.title: Setting a MIDI Source
pages.text: The top left section of the Instrument GUI lets you configure the MIDI Source to use for this instrument.

pages.title: MIDI Channel Toggles
pages.text: The numbered buttons spanning the full length of the GUI are the MIDI channel toggles. These buttons allow you to toggle each MIDI channel on or off for this instrument when it is playing from a MIDI Source.$(br2)Channel 10 is a special color to indicate that it is primarily used for percussion.$(br2)The X and O buttons allow you to clear and enable all channels, respectively.

pages.title: Keyboard Layout
pages.text: The top right section of the Instrument GUI lets you cycle between keyboard layouts for the piano. The selected layout is saved globally using the $(l:config_file)Config File$(/l), not per-instrument.$(br2)$(l)MIMI$() is the default mode and is a 'floating' mode where the same keys are used regardless of where you are on the keyboard. This mode allows you to play all notes from C0-G10 but only the notes currently visible on your screen.

pages.title: Keyboard Layout
pages.text: $(l)VPiano$() is a mode that uses the same layout as virtualpiano.net and is a 'static' mode where keys are assigned to specific notes and do not follow your current view on the keyboard.$(br2)This mode allows you to play notes from C2-C7 and play notes that are not currently visible on your screen. This mode is case-sensitive so in order to play the black keys you will need to hold Shift.
